tasks.title: Cloud Scaling Architecture Analysis & Implementation Plan
tasks.description: Comprehensive technical architecture analysis for scaling dhafnck_mcp server to handle 1000-1,000,000 requests per second on cloud infrastructure. Includes multi-phase analysis documents with specialized agent contributions.

subtasks.title: Phase 01: Current Architecture Analysis
subtasks.description: Comprehensive analysis of current DhafnckMCP architecture with @system-architect-agent, @coding-agent, and @performance-load-tester-agent

subtasks.title: Phase 02: Scaling Requirements & Performance Analysis
subtasks.description: Detailed performance analysis and scaling requirements with @performance-load-tester-agent, @system-architect-agent, and @devops-agent

subtasks.title: Phase 03: Technology Stack Evaluation
subtasks.description: Comprehensive technology stack analysis and recommendations with @technology-advisor-agent, @system-architect-agent, and @security-auditor-agent

subtasks.description: Comprehensive database transformation strategy with @system-architect-agent, @devops-agent, and @security-auditor-agent

subtasks.description: Comprehensive frontend architecture and API gateway design with @ui-designer-agent, @system-architect-agent, and @security-auditor-agent

subtasks.title: Phase 07: Backend Microservices Architecture
subtasks.description: Microservices decomposition and implementation with @system-architect-agent, @coding-agent, and @devops-agent

subtasks.title: Phase 08: Security & Compliance Framework
subtasks.description: Comprehensive security and compliance framework design with @security-auditor-agent and @system-architect-agent

subtasks.description: Comprehensive implementation roadmap with detailed task breakdown, migration strategy, and resource planning with @task-planning-agent and @devops-agent

subtasks.title: Phase 10: Monitoring, Observability & SRE
subtasks.description: Comprehensive monitoring, observability, and SRE framework with @health-monitor-agent and @devops-agent

tasks.title: EPIC: Phase 00 MVP - Docker + Supabase Implementation
tasks.description: Complete implementation of Phase 00 MVP with Docker containerization and Supabase authentication for fastest time-to-market (1-2 weeks development). This EPIC covers all tasks needed to deliver a working MVP that users can deploy locally with Docker while using cloud authentication.
tasks.details:
## ðŸŽ¯ **EPIC: Phase 00 MVP Success Criteria**

### **Primary Objectives**
- Deliver working MVP in 1-2 weeks for immediate user value
- Validate market demand before investing in full cloud architecture
- Provide foundation for future scaling phases

### **âœ… Acceptance Criteria**
1. **User Authentication & Token Management**
   - Users can create accounts via Supabase web interface
   - Users can generate, view, and revoke API tokens
   - Token validation works between frontend and backend

2. **Docker Deployment**
   - Single Docker container runs locally with all dependencies
   - SQLite database persists data across container restarts
   - Container size < 200MB for efficient distribution
   - Health checks and proper logging implemented

3. **Cursor Integration**
   - Cursor can connect to MCP server using generated tokens
   - All core MCP tools function correctly (task/project management)
   - Connection is stable and responsive

4. **Core Functionality**
   - Task management (create, update, list, search)
   - Project management (create, manage task trees)
   - Agent management (register, assign, orchestrate)
   - Basic subtask and dependency support

5. **Security & Reliability**
   - Token-based authentication implemented
   - Basic input validation and error handling
   - Secure communication between components
   - No critical security vulnerabilities

6. **User Experience**
   - New users can get started in < 30 minutes
   - Clear documentation and setup instructions
   - Troubleshooting guide for common issues
   - Docker Hub image available for easy download

### **ðŸ“Š Success Metrics**
- **Timeline**: Complete within 14 days
- **Quality**: 95% test coverage for core functionality
- **Performance**: < 100ms response time for basic operations
- **Usability**: 90% of test users complete setup successfully

### **ðŸš¨ Risk Mitigation**
- **Week 1 Checkpoint**: Core infrastructure must be functional
- **Daily standups**: Track progress and identify blockers
- **Fallback plan**: Simplified feature set if timeline pressure
- **Technical debt**: Document shortcuts taken for future improvement

tasks.title: Week 1: Core Infrastructure Setup
tasks.description: Complete all core infrastructure components for MVP including Supabase setup, frontend development, backend implementation, and Docker configuration. This represents the foundation of the MVP.

subtasks.title: Day 1: Supabase Project Setup (2 hours)
subtasks.description: Create and configure Supabase project with authentication and database schema

subtasks.title: Day 2-3: Next.js Frontend Development (2 days)
subtasks.description: Build authentication UI, dashboard, and token management components

subtasks.title: Day 4-5: Simplified MCP Server Development (2 days)
subtasks.description: Build FastAPI server with SQLite database and core MCP tools

subtasks.title: Day 6-7: Docker Configuration (1 day)
subtasks.description: Create Dockerfile, docker-compose, and container optimization

tasks.title: Week 2: Integration & Launch
tasks.description: Complete integration testing, documentation, and launch preparation for MVP. This includes token validation, end-to-end testing, documentation creation, and deployment.

subtasks.title: Day 1-2: Token Integration & Validation (2 days)
subtasks.description: Implement token validation between frontend and backend with error handling

subtasks.title: Day 3-4: Documentation & Getting Started Guide (2 days)
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive user documentation, Docker instructions, and Cursor setup guide

subtasks.title: Day 5-6: End-to-End Testing (2 days)
subtasks.description: Test complete user flow from registration to Cursor connection and MCP operations

subtasks.title: Day 7: Deployment & Launch (1 day)
subtasks.description: Deploy frontend to Vercel, publish Docker image, and announce MVP launch

tasks.title: Task: Supabase Project Configuration
tasks.description: Create new Supabase project, configure authentication settings, create database schema for API tokens, and set up Row Level Security policies.
tasks.details:
**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Supabase project created with proper naming
- [ ] Email/password authentication enabled
- [ ] API tokens table created with proper schema
- [ ] RLS policies configured for user data security
- [ ] Environment variables documented for integration

**Technical Requirements:**
- Project name: dhafnck-mcp-mvp
- Authentication: Email/password only (no OAuth for MVP)
- Database schema as defined in phase_00.mdc
- API keys and URLs ready for frontend integration

tasks.title: Task: Next.js Frontend Application
tasks.description: Build complete Next.js frontend with authentication, token management dashboard, and Docker instructions. Focus on functionality over aesthetics for MVP speed.
tasks.details:
**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Landing page with clear value proposition
- [ ] User registration/login with Supabase Auth
- [ ] Token management dashboard (generate, list, revoke)
- [ ] Docker instructions with user's token pre-filled
- [ ] Getting started guide integration
- [ ] Mobile-responsive design
- [ ] Error handling and user feedback

**Components to Build:**
- AuthLayout (login/signup forms)
- Dashboard (token management)
- TokenGenerator component
- DockerInstructions component
- GettingStarted component
- Navigation component

**Tech Stack:**
- Next.js 14 with App Router
- Supabase client for auth
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Lucide React for icons

tasks.title: Task: Simplified MCP Server Backend
tasks.description: Build lightweight FastAPI server with SQLite database, core MCP tools, and Supabase token validation. Simplify existing DhafnckMCP codebase for MVP requirements.
tasks.details:
**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] FastAPI server with health check endpoint
- [ ] SQLite database with schema initialization
- [ ] Token validation middleware using Supabase API
- [ ] Core MCP tools: manage_task, manage_project, manage_agent
- [ ] Error handling and logging
- [ ] Environment variable configuration
- [ ] API documentation with OpenAPI

**Core MCP Tools to Implement:**
- manage_task (CRUD operations)
- manage_project (basic project management)
- manage_agent (agent assignment)
- health_check (server status)

**Technical Requirements:**
- Python 3.11 compatibility
- SQLite database in /data directory
- Async/await patterns for performance
- Pydantic models for validation
- CORS configuration for frontend
- Rate limiting per token

tasks.title: Task: Docker Containerization
tasks.description: Create optimized Docker configuration for the MCP server with proper volume mounts, environment variables, and health checks. Target image size under 200MB.
tasks.details:
**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Multi-stage Dockerfile for optimized image size
- [ ] Docker Compose configuration for local development
- [ ] Volume mounts for data persistence
- [ ] Environment variable configuration
- [ ] Health check endpoint integration
- [ ] Container starts in under 30 seconds
- [ ] Image size under 200MB
- [ ] Documentation for Docker commands

**Docker Configuration:**
- Base image: python:3.11-slim
- Working directory: /app
- Data directory: /data (volume mounted)
- Exposed port: 8000
- Health check: GET /health
- Environment variables: DHAFNCK_TOKEN, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY

**Build Optimization:**
- Multi-stage build
- Minimal dependencies
- Layer caching optimization
- Security scanning ready

tasks.title: Task: Token Validation System
tasks.description: Implement secure token validation between frontend token generation and backend authentication, including token refresh and revocation mechanisms.
tasks.details:
**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Secure token generation (32-byte random)
- [ ] Token validation middleware in FastAPI
- [ ] Token revocation functionality
- [ ] Rate limiting per token
- [ ] Token expiration handling
- [ ] Error responses for invalid tokens
- [ ] Logging for security events

**Security Requirements:**
- Tokens stored securely in Supabase
- HTTPS-only token transmission
- Token validation against Supabase API
- Rate limiting: 100 requests per minute per token
- Token expiration: 30 days default
- Audit logging for token usage

**Integration Points:**
- Frontend: Token generation UI
- Backend: Validation middleware
- Supabase: Token storage and validation
- Docker: Environment variable configuration

tasks.title: Task: End-to-End Testing & Validation
tasks.description: Create comprehensive test suite covering the complete user journey from account creation to successful Cursor MCP connection and operations.
tasks.details:
**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] User registration/login flow testing
- [ ] Token generation and management testing
- [ ] Docker container deployment testing
- [ ] Cursor MCP connection testing
- [ ] Core MCP operations testing
- [ ] Error handling and edge case testing
- [ ] Performance validation (response times)
- [ ] Security testing (token validation)

**Test Scenarios:**
1. User creates account â†’ generates token â†’ copies Docker command
2. Docker container starts â†’ validates token â†’ exposes MCP endpoints
3. Cursor connects â†’ lists tools â†’ executes MCP operations
4. Token revocation â†’ connection fails appropriately
5. Invalid token â†’ proper error responses
6. Container restart â†’ data persistence verification

**Testing Tools:**
- Playwright for frontend E2E testing
- pytest for backend API testing
- Docker integration testing
- Cursor MCP connection validation
- Performance benchmarking

tasks.title: Task: Documentation & User Guides
tasks.description: Create comprehensive documentation including getting started guide, Docker setup instructions, Cursor configuration, and troubleshooting guide for MVP users.
tasks.details:
**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Getting Started guide with step-by-step instructions
- [ ] Docker installation and setup documentation
- [ ] Cursor MCP configuration examples
- [ ] Troubleshooting guide for common issues
- [ ] API documentation for developers
- [ ] Video tutorial (optional for MVP)
- [ ] FAQ section with common questions

**Documentation Structure:**
1. **Quick Start Guide** (5-minute setup)
   - Account creation
   - Token generation
   - Docker command execution
   - Cursor connection

2. **Detailed Setup Guide**
   - Prerequisites and requirements
   - Step-by-step installation
   - Configuration options
   - Environment variables

3. **Troubleshooting Guide**
   - Common connection issues
   - Docker problems
   - Token validation errors
   - Performance issues

4. **API Reference**
   - Available MCP tools
   - Request/response formats
   - Error codes and messages

tasks.title: Task: Deployment & Launch Preparation
tasks.description: Deploy frontend to Vercel, publish Docker image to Docker Hub, set up monitoring, and prepare for MVP launch announcement.
tasks.details:
**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Frontend deployed to Vercel with custom domain
- [ ] Docker image published to Docker Hub
- [ ] CI/CD pipeline configured for future updates
- [ ] Basic monitoring and analytics setup
- [ ] Launch announcement prepared
- [ ] Beta user onboarding process ready
- [ ] Feedback collection system in place

**Deployment Configuration:**
- **Frontend**: Vercel deployment with environment variables
- **Docker**: Multi-platform build (amd64, arm64)
- **Domain**: Custom domain configuration (dhafnck-mcp.com)
- **Monitoring**: Basic uptime and usage tracking
- **Analytics**: User registration and usage metrics

**Launch Checklist:**
- [ ] All tests passing
- [ ] Documentation complete
- [ ] Performance benchmarks met
- [ ] Security review completed
- [ ] Beta user list prepared
- [ ] Launch announcement ready
- [ ] Support channels configured

tasks.title: Task: MVP Database Schema Design
tasks.description: Design simplified database schema for MVP SQLite implementation, focusing on core entities (users, projects, tasks, agents) with minimal complexity while maintaining data integrity.

tasks.title: Task: Core MCP API Specification
tasks.description: Define API specification for core MCP tools in MVP, including request/response schemas, error handling, and authentication patterns. Focus on essential task and project management endpoints.

tasks.title: Task: MVP Performance Baseline
tasks.description: Establish performance baseline for MVP including response times, memory usage, and basic load testing. Document performance characteristics for future scaling reference.

tasks.title: ðŸ“‹ MILESTONE: Week 1 Checkpoint - Infrastructure Ready
tasks.description: Critical milestone ensuring core infrastructure components are functional by end of Week 1. This checkpoint validates that the foundation is solid before moving to integration phase.
tasks.details:
## ðŸŽ¯ **Week 1 Checkpoint Criteria**

### **âœ… Must Be Complete**
1. **Supabase Configuration** (Task 20250627005)
   - Project created and configured
   - Authentication tables and policies set up
   - API keys and environment variables documented

2. **Database Schema** (Task 20250627013)  
   - SQLite schema designed and validated
   - Migration scripts created
   - Data model documentation complete

3. **API Specification** (Task 20250627014)
   - Core MCP endpoints defined
   - Request/response schemas documented
   - Authentication patterns specified

4. **Frontend Foundation** (Task 20250627006)
   - Next.js project structure created
   - Supabase integration working
   - Basic authentication flow functional

5. **Backend Foundation** (Task 20250627007)
   - FastAPI server structure created
   - SQLite database connection working
   - Core MCP tools skeleton implemented

### **ðŸš¨ Go/No-Go Decision**
- **GO**: All 5 components functional â†’ Proceed to Week 2
- **NO-GO**: Any critical component missing â†’ Extend Week 1 or reduce scope

### **ðŸ“Š Success Metrics**
- All Week 1 tasks marked as "done"
- Frontend can authenticate users via Supabase
- Backend can validate tokens and serve basic responses
- Database schema supports core MVP requirements
- No blocking technical issues identified
